item.title: Tricolor
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I want a low hedge to rein in the unruly Rubus tricolor (Chinese Bramble) in the #ForestGarden.

item.title: Ouch
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Oak Park ground cover in the #ForestGarden finished! Does anyone else swear profusely after a few hours of back-breaking planting?

item.title: Plantain
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I‚Äôm sure I remember @themontydon saying on @gwandshows a few months ago that plantains have a large number of mycorrhizal fungi in the roots.

item.title: Hedgehog
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The People‚Äôs Orchard @peoplesorchardstdogs have a Tale with Hedgely Hospital, the Hedgehog Rescue West Wales, Thursday 18th October at The Coach House, St Dogmaels 7‚Äì8.

item.title: Nasturtiums
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: You see, you can have annuals in the #ForestGarden. Just so long as they‚Äôre on the useful scale üòâ

item.title: Ros
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Gave a #ForestGarden tour to Ros & Los from Llechryd Gardening Club, as I‚Äôm giving a talk on 8th May 2019.

item.title: Quince
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Our solitary quince in the #ForestGarden üòû

item.title: Benefits
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: A #ForestGarden is all about the trees, and Urban Forestry Network handily lists the benefits.

item.title: Spider
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Almost missed this spider in the #ForestGarden

item.title: Strawberries
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: üçì üëÄ Today I have mostly been planting strawberries in the #ForestGarden. They‚Äôre Fragaria chiloensis.

item.title: Understand
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚Äúif you understand each other you will be kind to each other‚Äù

item.title: Review
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: We now have five 5 star ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê reviews on TripAdvisor, thank you Donna üôÇ.

item.title: Chillibasket
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: @airpotgardener we‚Äôve had about two baskets of chillies this size from the 6-7 Alberto‚Äôs Locoto plants.

item.title: Storm
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: After the storm in the #ForestGarden, the ‘Cosse Violette’ Purple french beans are on the floor.

item.title: Ow
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The Alberto‚Äôs Locoto chilli peppers are almost #ForestGarden, I‚Äôve been growing them as perennials in pots, bringing them into the conservatory for winter.

item.title: Id
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Couple of handy apps for #BugID & #PlantID via @margaretroach A Way To Garden podcast, Leps by Fieldguide for butterflies and iNaturalist for plants & everything.

item.title: Rose
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Rosa rugosa in bloom in the #ForestGarden, sitting next to ripe hips! It really is a #SecondSpring

item.title: Asparagus
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Has anyone successfully grown a low perennial ground cover with asparagus? I‚Äôm thinking of trying Rubus pentalobus, a low growing Taiwanese raspberry.

item.title: Valley
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bore da and good morning. Misty again, plenty of rain last night, no wind.

item.title: Flamegun
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Andew @Quickrop may be stocking the Sheen flame gun. I‚Äôm definitely interested, obviously not a fan of weedkiller but we have half a mile of stone track.

item.title: Aquilega
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: With the storm raging in the #ForestGarden, I‚Äôm collecting the seed for Aquilegia vulgaris, thinking of the beautiful flowers for next year.

item.title: Soup
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: You know you‚Äôre trying to do too much when you burn the soup üòû Lots planned for the #ForestGarden next year but I really do need to do one thing at a time!

item.title: Peat free
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Can we not just BAN PEAT-BASED COMPOST? #PeatFree

item.title: Bramley
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bumper crop in #ForestGarden from the established Bramley tree (‚ÄúThe Beast of the Orchard‚Äô).

item.title: Storm
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Mae‚Äôr storm yn dawd / The storm is coming, in the #ForestGarden. Have staked the rather flimsy bean supports & shut the polytunnel up tight.

item.title: Chillies
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bumper crop from Alberto Locoto chillie peppers in the polytunnel, from The Real Seed Catalogue.

item.title: Ripple
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Away from the #ForestGarden, out for a walk with @ForestGdnDog by the local river.

item.title: Rhodedendron
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Planted a Rhododendron ‘Cunningham’s White’ hedge, for privacy and a windbreak. Not exactly #ForestGarden but that‚Äôs the thing, forest gardens are inclusive spaces üôÇ

item.title: Valley
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Early evening view across the valley from the #ForestGarden, a welcome and refreshing tonic after a long day of removing the cement render from the house.

item.title: Spring
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It‚Äôs a weird #SecondSpring in the #ForestGarden, with the Cornus sericea ‘Flaviramea’ in full bloom, and now the summer raspberry.

item.title: Misty
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bore da, morning. Misty in the valley.

item.title: Achocha seed
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Have a large collection of Giant Bolivian Achocha seed, after a night of preparing it for the freezer.

item.title: Render
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Not #ForestGarden action today, been busy taking the cement render off the front of the house.

item.title: Order
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I might accidentally have bought 15 #ForestGarden plants from Agroforestry Research Trust: Cornelian Cherry (Cornus mas) Gourmet Haw Crataegus arnoldiana Bladdernut (Staphylea pinnata) Chestnut (Castanea) Marigoule seedling Hazelnut (Corylus avellana) Corabel 2L Hazelnut (Corylus avellana) Webbs prize Cob Elaeagnus umbellata Big Red Gaultheria procumbens Highbush Cranberry (Viburnum trilobum) Phillips Highbush Cranberry (Viburnum trilobum) Wentworth Groundcover Raspberry Rubus pentalobus Emerald Carpet Rhubarb (Rheum palmatum tanguticum) Turkish Re Mahonia aquifolium Phyllostachys viridi-glaucescens Yushania anceps Pitt White

item.title: Talk & tour for 2019!
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just received the first booking for #ForestGarden talk & tours for 2019! The talk is at Llechryd Gardening Club on 8th May and their private tour will be in early June.

item.title: Achocha
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The Giant Bolivian Achocha plants (a giant green jungle in the polytunnel) have started producing masses of fruit, destined for the freezer.

item.title: Curry
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Picked a bowlful of veg for a curry from the #ForestGarden, Good King Henry leaves, Welsh Onions and ‘Cosse Violette’ Purple Pole Bean, in a homemade tomato pur√©e from Grushkova bush tomatoes and spiced up with Alberto’s Locoto chillies.

item.title: Front
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Moody barns, when the sun was shining yesterday. Visible is the dairy which will be transformed into a food preparation & storage area, for all the produce from the #ForestGarden.

item.title: Guelder
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Guelder. Rose. From the #ForestGarden.

item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Looking out of the window like it‚Äôs 1975‚Ä¶

item.title: Mulberry
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bore da byd, a hidden harvest in the #ForestGarden, mulberry Morus alba x rubra ‘Illinois Everbearing’.

item.title: Scythe
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just been out scything the ‚Äúmeadow‚Äù in the #ForestGarden, and accidentally scythed a wasps‚Äô nest.

item.title: Rain
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bore da byd. Maen bwrw glau heddiw, it‚Äôs raining today, so no bonfire. Instead, a bit of wet scything and a photo from yesterday, when the sun was out, showing the clearing of the brick path in front of the house.

item.title: Pigsty
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Renovated pigstys and carthouse (cartws yn Cymraeg) looking lovely, with fruitfully pruned Bramley apple

item.title: Propagation
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I‚Äôve been propagating Symphytum ibericum (Dwarf Comfrey) and Vinca minor (Lesser Periwinkle) for the new Ornamental, Maintenance-free #ForestGarden.

item.title: Cornus
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It feels like a #SecondSpring out in the #ForestGarden, the Cornus stolonifera flaviramea is in flower again, attracing the pollinators.

item.title: Bore-Da
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Bore da byd! Good morning world!

item.title: Poppies
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I know they‚Äôre only small and I know they‚Äôre only poppies but I love ‚Äôem üòç

item.title: Dragonfly
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw this little critter dragonfly near the #ForestGarden, sunning itself on some old timber.

item.title: Prolific
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I thought there were two established damson trees in the #ForestGarden. Turns out Martin Hayes (orchardist to the rich & famous) actually thinks they are Prolific, a variety related to Early Prolific.

item.title: Mist
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Morning, morning, mist in the valleys, blue in the sky and autumn in the air üôÇ

item.title: Beetle
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw this lovely black/blue-purple dung beetle on a walk down to the river today #BugID

item.title: FruitID
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: A neighbour has some apples they want to identify & Martin Hayes, orchardist to the stars, recommended fruitID.

item.title: Bunias
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Rejigging the #ForestGarden this winter, so that leafy greens are nearer the entrance. Bunias orientalis (Turkish Rocket) seed ready to sow in spring.

item.title: Plum
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: This is what happens if you neglect your pruning in a #ForestGarden, a single Victoria plum!

item.title: Puree
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Not exactly #ForestGarden produce but it is that tomato pur√©e time of year!

item.title: Bee
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Found this #bee by the river on a Himalayan Balsam flower, quite large, almost black and white #BugID

item.title: Waterfall
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Took a break from the #ForestGarden yesterday, went to the local waterfall on the river Ceri.

item.title: Badgers
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Next door farm has kindly let us run an electric fence off their supply, we‚Äôre doing this to keep the badgers out of the #ForestGarden & chicken compound.

item.title: Jam
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The first jam of the season from the #ForestGarden, a rather sour but still tasty damson jam, and quite a lot of pickled cucumber.

item.title: Reclaimed
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Here‚Äôs the reclaimed #ForestGarden wood chip in use on the flower beds in front of the old barns.

item.title: Woodchip
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Hot üî• #ForestGarden tip: ask your local arboricultural service if you can have their left over wood chip.

item.title: Groundcherries
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Groundcherry they said. 5 foot high and rising in the #ForestGarden polytunnel, will rename them skycherries at this rate!

item.title: Harvest
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚ÄúThe first harvest is always the sweetest‚Äù to quote, well, myself. Our first grapes from the #ForestGarden polytunnel.

item.title: Runners
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Rule #1: propagate everything in a #ForestGarden! Some Fragaria chiloensis runners popped in a pot in the propagation beds.

item.title: Damson
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It‚Äôs gonna be damson jam time soon in the #ForestGarden!

item.title: Achocha
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I picked the first achocha fruit for a stir-fry. Not sure what to expect!

item.title: Stingingless
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Received a packet of sting-less Fen Nettle seeds from @BackyardLarder for the #ForestGarden. Very excited!

item.title: Sale
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: #ForestGarden Wales tour tickets available ¬£20, incl coffee & cake, beautiful site, presentation, plant stall https://forestgardenwales.

item.title: Tickets
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: #ForestGarden Wales tour tickets on sale ¬£20, incl coffee & cake, beautiful site, presentation, plant stall https://forestgardenwales.

item.title: Tour
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just finished fantastic #ForestGarden tour with @EmmaSharpe26 & friends, very inspirational, uplifting to talk with plant lovers üíö üôÇ I‚Äôve been neglecting #ForestGarden as trying to get paid work in, pleased to report it‚Äôs generally very resilient, ideally suited to the part-time, in absentia gardener!

item.title: Well
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Which plants have you found to flourish in the #drought? My top 3 are:

item.title: Ugni
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: A new addition to the #ForestGarden, an Ugni molinae (Chilean Guava) from St Davids Pland & Garden Nursery.

item.title: Clouds
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Yep, rain clouds over the #ForestGarden. Relief, 7mm of rain in 24 hours.

item.title: Squash
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Close up of squash leaf in evening sun in the polytunnel.

item.title: Myrica
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Waiting for the rain to come in the #ForestGarden‚Ä¶ then I can plant out the damp-loving Myrica gale (Bog Myrtle), currently residing in an old bath, keeping its feet damp.

item.title: Harvesetman
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: There‚Äôs been an abundance of harvestman spiders! Or rather, Opilones

item.title: Fabulous
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: This makes me smile every time I walk down the street üôÇ

item.title: Wasp
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw the most amazing wasp in the conservatory, browny red and yellow with great long dangling appendages.

item.title: Hot tip: hedging
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: #ForestGarden #HotTip üî• Grow a non-spikey hedging plant, eg Cornus, at the end of a Rosa rugosa hedge, so you don‚Äôt get spiked when you walk past.

item.title: Fathers‚Äô Day
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Had to share this photo of my 7 year old‚Äôs popup #ForestGarden Fathers‚Äô Day card.

item.title: Rain
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Rain relief in the #ForestGarden. You will all have your own stories and experiences, here’s a small snippet of rain on the conservatory roof.

item.title: Tour
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Next #ForestGarden tour & talk Sat 4th August 10am‚Äì1pm, coffee & cake, tickets only ¬£10 https://forestgardenwales.

item.title: Nuts
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Really good idea from last #ForestGarden tour about growing nut trees surrounded by grass (and dogs!

item.title: Dragonfly
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I saw a Golden-ringed Dragonfly last week on the site of what will be the rebuilt farmyard pond.

item.title: Tour
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Next #ForestGarden tour & talk Sat 4th Aug 10am‚Äì1pm, coffee & cake, tickets ¬£10 from https://forestgardenwales.

item.title: Green
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: My little boy walked into the polytunnel the other day and said ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs gone all green!

item.title: Tour
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Next #ForestGarden tour & talk is Saturday 4th August 10am‚Äì1pm, coffee & cake included, tickets only ¬£10 from forestgardenwales.

item.title: Butterflies
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Margaret Roach @aWayToGarden has an excellent podcast with Jane Hurwitz, author of Butterfly Gardening.

item.title: Talk
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just to let people know, intro to #ForestGarden talk is online at www.forestgarden.wales/talks/intro üôÇ.

item.title: Friends
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The #ForestGarden tour went really well yesterday, Martin Hayes, orchardist to the stars abd The People‚Äôs Orchard, came along as well and offered plenty of valuable insights.

item.title: Buses
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Tomatoes like buses, Big Fat Red Buses‚Ä¶ (#ForestGarden in the background)

item.title: Veganelectricity
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Interesting campaign by @ecotricity to emphasise that they supply vegan electricity. As a vegetarian, I never knew that animal by-products made up 1% of electricity generation, see Is your energy supply vegan?

item.title: Wyndrush Wild Meadow
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: There are spaces available on the minibus for trip to Matt Sutton‚Äôs fantastic wildflower meadows in Carew Pembs, organised by the brilliant The People‚Äôs Orchard.

item.title: Buses
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Tomatoes are like buses: red, shiny and 3 at the same time! After yesterday‚Äôs first tomato, there‚Äôs more on the way.

item.title: Tickets
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Only 10 tickets left for the #ForestGarden tour this Saturday 7th July! The world famous vegan chocolate brownies alone are worth the admission price of ¬£10 plus you get to hear me wax lyrical about low maintenance, productive gardens.

item.title: Evening
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Had to post this photo from the #ForestGarden, looking out over next door‚Äôs field the other night.

item.title: Meadowsweet
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The Ulmaria filipendula (Meadowsweet) is in bloom in the Predator Strip, the ominously named row of predator friendly flowering plants.

item.title: Course
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just heard that there are 1 day #ForestGarden courses in Aberdeen run by Alan Carter from Of Plums and Pignuts in July, August and September.

item.title: Tomato
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The first tomato of the year! It‚Äôs a bush variety, ‘Latah’, from the Real Seed Catalogue, and it tastes lovely üçÖ üòÑ

item.title: Toona sinensis
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Had our first taste of Toona sinensis (Chinese Cedar) from the #ForestGarden yesterday, in a stir-fry with broccoli and onions.

item.title: Achocha fruit
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Photo of a tiny achocha fruit, slipper shaped and emerald green for @thepubgardener üôÇ

item.title: Horseflies
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I have been bitten by horse flies half a dozen times this summer in the #ForestGarden, a massive increase in horse fly attacks.

item.title: Tours
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The next public #ForestGarden tour is Saturday 7th July 2018, only a week and a half away!

item.title: Achocha
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: @thepubgardener I really meant to write that blog post, honestly!! But in the meantime, the achocha has started to take over the polytunnel üò±

item.title: Moth
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Getting ready for the visit by @PermaTywi for #ForestGarden tour tomorrow, clearing some grass and this beautiful moth landed on the scythe handle #BugID

item.title: Volunteers
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The People‚Äôs Orchard in St Dogmaels are running a free mulching workshop with Stefan Cartwright over in Llechryd, near Cardigan, West Wales this Friday 22nd June 10.

item.title: Mash
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The best mash root vegetable and shallot recipe, ever, in the world, courtesy Yotam Ottolenghi from his book Plenty More: http://simp.

item.title: Red Bum
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: If you ever wonder what happened to the dinosaurs, take a look at this slow motion video!

item.title: Gold
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I have a peculiar fondness for growing tomatoes. No matter the green stained fingers when nipping out side shoots, it‚Äôs that pungent smell and golden sheen, it‚Äôs a little bit of magic in the polytunnel.

item.title: Death
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚ÄúDeath is a shadow cast by the light of life‚Äù. We had a successful #ForestGarden tour today but midway through, one of the chickens was killed by a fox.

item.title: Late
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It‚Äôs late, we have a #ForestGarden group tour tomorrow, I‚Äôve baked the world famous Chocolate Vegan Brownies, updated the intro to forest gardening talk, here‚Äôs a photo of Fruit Triangle and the polytunnel.

item.title: Windy
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Morning, morning, is it still the morning? Very windy day in the #ForestGarden, I shut the polytunnel up tight last night.

item.title: Art
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I love foxgloves and if they self-seed somewhere in the #ForestGarden, I tend to leave them be.

item.title: Goldfinch
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw a pair of goldfinches in the #ForestGarden, perched on a cattle fence, leaning over to eat the seed heeds on some long grass and docks!

item.title: Glangwili
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Took a break from the #ForestGarden today, went to Glangwili Lodges near #Carmarthen, open under the @NGSOpenGardens scheme.

item.title: Dragonfly
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: This dark dragonfly was in the #ForestGarden polytunnel, a bit stubby, paler blue top abdomen #BugID.

item.title: Posy
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I absent-mindedly stripped grass seed in the #ForestGarden last night, made a small ‚Äúgrass seed posy‚Äù.

item.title: Diversity
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Out in the ‚Äúmeadow‚Äù in the #ForestGarden, really noticed the diversity of the different grasses.

item.title: Tour
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The next public #ForestGarden tour is only 4 weeks away, Saturday 4th July 2018!

item.title: Mulch
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: If it doesn‚Äôt move, mulch it, in the #ForestGarden and everywhere else as well.

item.title: Talked
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I gave my #ForestGarden Magic talk to Drefach Felindre Gardening Club last night, and donated my speaker‚Äôs fee of ¬£50 to @savechildrenuk.

item.title: Calm
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It is the calm before the #ForestGarden talk. My first ever talk to a gardening club.

item.title: Mulch
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The People‚Äôs Orchard are running a mulching workshop with Stefan Cartwright, near Llechryd. Really worth a visit, contact Nia or Sophie via The Coach House website www.

item.title: Viburnum
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The Amelanchier canadensis (Juneberry) have just finished flowering in the North Facde windbreak, and now the Viburnum opulus (Guelder Rose) are flowering.

item.title: Talk
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I‚Äôm giving a talk about the #ForestGarden to Drefach Felindre Gardening Club this Wednesday 6th June at 7.

item.title: Tour
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Had a very successful #ForestGarden tour yesterday with five people. The introduction talk is online, as is the ever-popular vegan chocolate brownie recipe!

item.title: Moth
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: This magnificent moth was trapped in the conservatory, speckled black and white with an orange flush around the head and raised tail.

item.title: Tuber
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: My 7 year old found these tubers where the diggers have been clearing the old farm pond ‚Äì¬†anyone any ideas what they are?

item.title: Achocha
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I‚Äôve always struggled with some plants in the polytunnel, specifically peppers and aubergines. I think it‚Äôs because they know my heart ‚ù§Ô∏è is outside in the #ForestGarden üòâ.

item.title: Three stages
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just finished putting down bark mulch in ‚ÄòOak Park‚Äô in the #ForestGarden. About 70 wheel barrows full.

item.title: The purpose of a plan
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Just had a thought about why you create a #ForestGarden plan. Help plan what to plant where.

item.title: Fly
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Found this little critter on a fence post in the #ForestGarden. Not sure what it is, really need to get hold of a fly ID book‚Ä¶¬†#BugID

item.title: Viburnum opulus in flower
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The Guelder Rose (Viburnum opulus) in the North Face #ForestGarden windbreak is flowering! Lucky to be surrounded by all this beauty ü§©.

item.title: PFAF appeal
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Plants For A Future @PFAF_Tweets is a fantastic online resource for information about all manner of useful plants.

item.title: Temporary ground cover
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The mustard is in flower (Sinapis alba, brilliant yellow flower, really strongly scented. It‚Äôs a temporary ground cover in the #ForestGarden, used to allow the perennial ground cover to establish (on the Blue Bean Border, we‚Äôve planted Rubus nepalensis, Glechomae hederacea and Vinca minor).

item.title: Medlar
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Wow. The medlar (Mespilus germanica) in full bloom in the #ForestGarden. A favourite with the children, as it‚Äôs also known as The Dog‚Äôs Arse tree!

item.title: Sweet chestnut
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: A couple of years ago, I bought a Castanea sativa ‘Numbo’ from Agroforestry Trust, and it was hammered by the slugs, so much so, it‚Äôs become multi-stemmed.

item.title: Crabapple
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Crabapple ‚ÄòJohn Downie‚Äô in blossom, has been blossoming for a while, good pollinator for other apple trees.

item.title: Plantday
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Heads up people, it‚Äôs Fascination of Plants Day tomorrow Friday 18th May! #PlantDay #FoPD https://www.

item.title: Cabbage
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: A surfeit of Asturian Tree Cabbage seedlings from The Real Seed Catalogue. I think they‚Äôre going to be like collards but I‚Äôm not sure.

item.title: Fly
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw this cutesy little red-eyed fly the other day on a tulip flower, kind of looks like a fruit fly but as with most insects, no idea what it is!

item.title: Cardoon
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Last year I splashed out on 3 cardoons (Cynara cardunculus) in a bargain basement sale (5 plants for ¬£5) from Trefhedyn garden centre.

item.title: Symphytum
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Symphytum ibericum (dwarf or iberian comfrey) in flower last night, really beautiful and doing very well in the dry shade (eek) under the ash trees üôÇ

item.title: Wet wipes
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Via @UE, how come wet wipes aren‚Äôt biodegradable?!? Craziness! Contact your wet wipe supplier and your MP https://www.

item.title: Meadow
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I wouldn‚Äôt really call it #meadow but we have a small area of grass in the #ForestGarden, which has proved really useful as a mulch when scythed.

item.title: Cornus
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The green, green flower buds of Cornus stolonifera ‘flaviramea’, like little bundles of loveliness üôÇ

item.title: Gorse
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It‚Äôs gorse of course in the #ForestGarden! Actually, these gorse bushes were down at Poppit Sands but we do have some gorse (Ulex europeaus).

item.title: Mustard
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: This is last year‚Äôs Sinapis alba (white mustard) #ForestGarden ground cover ‚Äì thickly sown last summer, and it has given the strawberry and alefoot (Fragaria viridis and Glechoma hederacea) a chance to get established.

item.title: Tours
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Half-day #ForestGarden tour & talk now open to individuals üôÇ. First Saturday of the month, May‚ÄìSeptember.

item.title: View
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The sun was shining in the #ForestGarden the other day‚Ä¶

item.title: Moth
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: #Moth I found a beautiful red moth in the polytunnel (and I released it).

item.title: Pear
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The Conference pear is in blossom the most ever! Big thanks to Martin Hayes for his deft pruning work.

item.title: Sustainable
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Can we have sustainable farming on an industrial scale? Can we afford not to have sustainable farming on an industrial scale?

item.title: Greens
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It might not look like much but this is our first proper leaf harvest from the #ForestGarden: chard, good king henry, nettle tops and some bits of purple sprouting broccoli.

item.title: Two
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The solitary swallow that arrived 5 days ago has company! Counted 3 swallows today, summer on the way, slowly üôÇ

item.title: Holden
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Very good to hear Patrick Holden from @SusFoodTrust on @BBCr4today this morning with Tom Bradshaw @ProagriLtd ‚Äì¬†opportunity to ‚Äúreintegrate food production with nature preservation‚Äù and take a good look at nitrate use in agriculture.

item.title: Butterfly
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I saw my first butterfly of the year today! An orange tip, one of my favourites.

item.title: Tidy
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: tidiness always costs you energy Just watched Martin Crawford on Forest Gardening Living With The Land, and this quote jumped out at me.

item.title: Swallow
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw the first swallow of the year yesterday! All on it‚Äôs lonesome üòû

item.title: OS maps
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Today I learned that first edition @OrdnanceSurvey maps in the UK (I think around the 1890s?

item.title: Native
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Excellent fact sheet from Linda Chalker-Scott (@LindaCS) about that old chestnut, native vs non-native for biodiversity:

item.title: TripAdvisor
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Group tours of Forest Garden Wales is on TripAdvisor! There were a few teething problems (it was inaccurately named Forest Garden Wakes for a while) but all okay now.

item.title: Gooseberry
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: On a walk around the forest garden tonight, I noticed the new leaves of the gooseberry Hinnomaki Red unfurling.

item.title: Crows nest
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: There‚Äôs a crows‚Äô nest in the oak tree at the north of the forest garden:

item.title: Vinca

item.description: Vinca minor (lesser periwinkle) in flower, with bark mulch and some white mustard temporary ground cover sprouting

item.description: Bird box on the back of the sycamore

item.title: Coaltown
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Picked up some @coaltowncoffee compost coffee grounds from the Fisherman‚Äôs Rest in Cardigan. It‚Äôs lovely, smells of coffee ‚òï.

item.title: Herbs
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: How to Grow Herbs at Home, blog post by @quickcrop https://www.quickcrop.ie/blog/2018/04/grow-herbs-home/

item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Morning morning, damson blossom by the summer house. Damp but springlike

item.title: Tours
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: We‚Äôre now running half-day tour & talk of our forest garden. Coffee & cake, ¬£10 per head, min 5 people https://www.

item.title: Exploding
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Giant Bolivian Achocha are germinating! I‚Äôm no good at sweet peppers, so hopefully this will plug that gap.

item.description: Asian pear blossom this morning

item.title: Morning
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Morning morning, spring is a-coming, the sun is kind of a-shining, the birds are definitely singing.

item.title: Mailing
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: You can now subscribe to the Forest Garden Wales mailing list! I‚Äôll be writing a round-up of forest garden news once a month and mailing it out üôÇ

item.title: Comfrey
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Top Comfrey Tip: when making a comfrey fertiliser, don‚Äôt add water. Simply put the chopped up comfrey in a colander (or other container with holes) and let the comfrey decompose and collect the liquid beneath.

item.title: The People‚Äôs Orchard
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The People‚Äôs Orchard inaugural visit to @ForestGdnWales has just ended! Alas, no photographs, I was too busy talking about forest gardens.

item.title: It
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It lives! A freebie loganberry (Rubus loganobaccus) from Ty Rhos trees, in leaf and alive üòÉ

item.description: Fantastic morning with People‚Äôs Orchard @peoplesorchardstdogs and Martin Hayes (orchardist) planting apple and pear tree orchard by the car park picnic area at Poppit Sands, St Dogmaels, West Wales.

item.description: Moody photo of the polytunnel
